content:
• Friday, February 17, 2012
  • IPAS

    A good week got better for iPass (IPAS +16.5%) after the provider of remote mobile networking...

    A good week got better for iPass (IPAS +16.5%) after the provider of remote mobile networking services for businesses delivered its Q4 report. Though revenue of $34.4M fell 11% and breakeven EPS missed estimates by $0.02, iPass reported adjusted EBITDA of $0.8M for the quarter, which is up from a loss of $0.3M in Q3. iPass also said it added over 80 large enterprise customers, bringing its total above 320.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • LEAF

    Up modestly at first following its Q4 beat, Demand Media (DMD) finished with a giant 30.6% gain....

    Up modestly at first following its Q4 beat, Demand Media (DMD) finished with a giant 30.6% gain. The Q4 results, along with Demand's guidance for 2012 revenue of $351M-$358M and EPS of $0.30-$0.32 (consensus of $362.3M and $0.31), appear to have calmed investors worried about Google's algorithm changes. JMP believes current estimates could prove conservative if Demand's investments in new content pay off.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • AMAT

    Up initially thanks to its FQ1 beat and FQ2 guidance, Applied Materials (AMAT -1.7%) closed with...

    Up initially thanks to its FQ1 beat and FQ2 guidance, Applied Materials (AMAT -1.7%) closed with a loss; shares were up 23% on the year heading into earnings. UBS remains concerned Applied's solar equipment unit will lose money in 2012, and also considers its display equipment business "a 2013 story." But Needham thinks a recovery in chip equipment demand makes Applied a long-term buy. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • CDXS

    Biocatalyst developer Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) falls 12.9% AH after announcing CEO Alan Shaw has...

    Biocatalyst developer Codexis (NASDAQ:CDXS) falls 12.9% AH after announcing CEO Alan Shaw has resigned to "pursue other interests." Peter Strumph, head of the company's pharmaceuticals division, will serve as interim CEO while the board searches for a full-time replacement. Codexis shares tumbled last week following the company's Q4 miss.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • CORT

    Corcept Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CORT), a specialty drug company that hasn’t generated revenue...

    Corcept Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CORT), a specialty drug company that hasn’t generated revenue since 2009, wins FDA approval for its Korlym treatment that uses the active ingredient of the abortion pill RU-486 to treat Cushing’s Syndrome. Shares +42.5% after a trading halt.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • BX

    Blackstone (NYSE:BX) has halted talks to acquire Brocade Communications (BRCD -2.2%) because the...

    Blackstone (NYSE:BX) has halted talks to acquire Brocade Communications (BRCD -2.2%) because the stock's price rose too high to make a leveraged buyout attractive, according to a Bloomberg report issued minutes prior to the market close. The maker of switches for data storage networks has been looking for a buyer since 2009.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • CLF

    Goldman Sachs cuts Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -2.9%) from its Conviction Buy list, noting the...

    Goldman Sachs cuts Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -2.9%) from its Conviction Buy list, noting the coal and iron ore producer's shares didn't get the expected boost from iron ore prices post-Lunar New Year. The firm remains bullish on CLF due to its leverage to the strong iron ore market, though it faces near-term pressure on a lagging iron ore price recovery.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +12.9%), up strongly on over 4x its normal trading volume thanks to buyout...

    Fusion-io (FIO +12.9%), up strongly on over 4x its normal trading volume thanks to buyout rumors, has issued a terse PR stating it refuses to comment on market activity. In October, Barron's named Fusion-io its top tech stock pick for 2012 out of a belief the server flash memory module vendor is a takeover target. Tech Insidr speculates Dell, EMC, NetApp, or Intel could be interested.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • FTR

    Frontier Communications (FTR +6.5%) shares push higher after reporting a weaker Q4 amid fewer...

    Frontier Communications (FTR +6.5%) shares push higher after reporting a weaker Q4 amid fewer subscribers but beating earnings estimates. Meanwhile, S&P Capital raises its rating on the regional telecommunications provider to Buy from Hold, saying its 47% dividend cut should help with debt reduction and support capital expenditures.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • PFCB

    P.F. Chang's China Bistro (PFCB +6%) lures the operating chief of Kona Grill (KONA -6.5%) to...

    P.F. Chang's China Bistro (PFCB +6%) lures the operating chief of Kona Grill (KONA -6.5%) to take the same spot at PFCB, one reason cited by Raymond James and RBC as each firm upgrades shares. The analysts also like PFCB's efforts to scale its chains down a bit to meet cost-conscious consumers, expecting real results to be seen in H2 of this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • BP

    BP jumps, +1.6% following news of Mitsui's (OTCPK:MITSY) $90M settlement for Clean Water Act...

    BP jumps, +1.6% following news of Mitsui's (OTCPK:MITSY) $90M settlement for Clean Water Act violations in the Deepwater Horizon spill. Whispers were about the government was going to go for a total of $20B, making $90M for BP's 10% partner lighter-than-expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • KHC

    They're loving ketchup in Russia, China and Brazil but not so much in the U.S., where Heinz (HNZ...

    They're loving ketchup in Russia, China and Brazil but not so much in the U.S., where Heinz (HNZ +4.6%) says FQ3 sales trailed strong international results. While revenue abroad spiked 20% and made up 20% of all sales, North American sales rose just 1.3% while volume slipped 2% as HNZ raised prices on its frozen potatoes, sauces and ketchup.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 4 Comments
  • ARTC

    Arthrocare (ARTC -17.8%) shares plunges a day after reporting a substantial Q4 loss attributed...

    Arthrocare (ARTC -17.8%) shares plunges a day after reporting a substantial Q4 loss attributed largely to hefty charges related to a proposed settlement of certain securities class action suits. Jefferies cuts its stock rating to Hold from Buy and drops its price target to $25 from $32, citing the "new and entirely unexpected" investigation which will preclude an anticipated takeover.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +4.2%) shares jump after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Hold at Stifel...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK +4.2%) shares jump after receiving an upgrade to Buy from Hold at Stifel Nicolaus. This is "an attractive entry point for a company whose stock has gone nowhere since late 2008 and yet has amassed a huge resource exposure with some large acreage positions in some of the best plays," the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • BCOV

    After pricing its 5M share IPO at $11, Brightcove (NASDAQ:BCOV) is trading at $14.98, up 36.2%....

    After pricing its 5M share IPO at $11, Brightcove (NASDAQ:BCOV) is trading at $14.98, up 36.2%. The fast-growing online video hosting provider originally filed for an IPO in August, and then recently re-filed. Concerns exist about competition from Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) and YouTube (NASDAQ:GOOG), among others, though Brightcove's high switching costs could help it keep rivals at bay.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • KSWS

    The bad times get worse for K-Swiss (KSWS -9.7%), after the shoemaker's Q4 miss and soft 2012...

    The bad times get worse for K-Swiss (KSWS -9.7%), after the shoemaker's Q4 miss and soft 2012 revenue guidance ($240M-$250M vs. consensus of $269.8M) demonstrate the challenges it faces in competing with larger rivals Nike (NYSE:NKE) and Adidas (OTCQX:ADDYY). K-Swiss' Q4 gross margin was just 25.6%, down 680 bps Y/Y and well below Nike's FQ2 gross margin of 42.7%. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • UPS

    UPS (UPS -1.3%) heads lower after Dutch delivery services firm TNT Express says it rejected a...

    UPS (UPS -1.3%) heads lower after Dutch delivery services firm TNT Express says it rejected a €9/share, or €4.9B ($6.4B), bid from UPS, while adding that discussions are ongoing. TNT shares closed at €6.34 today on the Amsterdam exchange.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • ZION

    Zions Bancorp (ZION +4.8%) shares surge following the regional bank’s investor day, where...

    Zions Bancorp (ZION +4.8%) shares surge following the regional bank’s investor day, where it tells investors it has enough capital and liquidity to repay its TARP obligations.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • WFC

    Wells Fargo (WFC +2%) moves up as Sterne Agee analyst Todd Hagerman says investors could see an...

    Wells Fargo (WFC +2%) moves up as Sterne Agee analyst Todd Hagerman says investors could see an "upside earnings surprise in 2012." Raising his price target to $36 from $33, he says shares "present a favorable risk/reward for investors looking for a well-capitalized bank with potential earnings catalysts in 2012." At yesterday's close, WFC traded for 1.8x its year-end 2011 tangible book value.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD -1.9%) is down after Baird cuts the stock to Neutral from Outperform, believing...

    Dell (DELL-OLD -1.9%) is down after Baird cuts the stock to Neutral from Outperform, believing the company’s operating model may be peaking this year. Dell reports Q4 results next Tuesday, and Baird thinks it did well, taking share and suffering less in the PC market, but that most margin improvement may be behind it.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (BIDU -4.4%), which sports a trailing P/E of 46, is selling off after the in-line guidance...

    Baidu (BIDU -4.4%), which sports a trailing P/E of 46, is selling off after the in-line guidance that accompanied its Q4 beat failed to impress. Morgan Stanley (Equal Weight), noting the slowdown in Baidu's customer adds, is concerned the macro issues faced by Chinese SMEs will slow down the company's growth. But Collins Stewart, Jefferies, and other are still bullish on account of Baidu's long-term growth potential. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • MXWL

    Ultracapacitor maker Maxwell (MXWL -6.1%) is selling off after posting in-line earnings and...

    Ultracapacitor maker Maxwell (MXWL -6.1%) is selling off after posting in-line earnings and guiding for a 5% Q/Q revenue decline (the Street was expecting a 4% increase). A $30M stock offering and a downgrade to Neutral from R.W. Baird also aren't helping. During its earnings call, Maxwell touted the strong growth potential of the automotive ultracapacitor market.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-IO (FIO +6.7%) shares surge on renewed takeover chatter suggesting Intel (INTC +1.7%)...

    Fusion-IO (FIO +6.7%) shares surge on renewed takeover chatter suggesting Intel (INTC +1.7%) could target the company in a deal, although the sources of the rumor appear questionable.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision (OVTI -1.2%) shares slip after J.P. Morgan cut its rating to Neutral from Overweight...

    OmniVision (OVTI -1.2%) shares slip after J.P. Morgan cut its rating to Neutral from Overweight based on valuation. The firm admits its stand risks missing an upswing in OVTI’s revenue and earnings, but notes the imaging sector is seeing "aggressive price-based competition from Sony, Samsung, Aptina and others."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM

  • WTI crude oil breaks out to its highest price since May, +1% to $103.29/barrel. One is reminded...

    WTI crude oil breaks out to its highest price since May, +1% to $103.29/barrel. One is reminded of the move in oil late last winter and spring, when its rise above $110/barrel helped snuff out what were then the stirrings of a stronger economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • JWN

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) -2.4% premarket after the upscale retailer guides same-store growth lower...

    Nordstrom (NYSE:JWN) -2.4% premarket after the upscale retailer guides same-store growth lower and investors decide 12.5% Q4 sales growth isn't enough. But KeyBanc is keeping the faith long term: "Nordstrom looks to accelerate its already extensive multi-channel investments... investing to maintain its leadership and relevance in an increasingly e-commerce focused retail environment."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • GEC

    Openwave (OPWV) +11.4% following a Wedbush note speculating "patent troll" Acacia Research...

    Openwave (OPWV) +11.4% following a Wedbush note speculating "patent troll" Acacia Research (NASDAQ:ACTG) might soon make a bid for the wireless IP holder. The firm notes Acacia recently raised $225M in a stock offering, and has said it's exploring a major acquisition. Openwave, which recently adopted a poison pill, surged in November after striking a patent licensing deal with Microsoft.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) -4% following the release of its 10-K, in which the company discloses it may...

    Clearwire (CLWR) -4% following the release of its 10-K, in which the company discloses it may eventually need to raise more capital in order to build out its 4G LTE network, though it has enough to last through the end of 2012. Though Sprint (NYSE:S) appears committed to keeping Clearwire afloat, the capital might not come cheap - the company just paid a 14.75% coupon on a $300M bond offering. (Q4 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • SPWR

    Solar stocks are moving higher premarket following SunPower's better-than-expected Q4 and...

    Solar stocks are moving higher premarket following SunPower's better-than-expected Q4 and Suntech's upward guidance for Q4 and FY2011: SPWR +12.3%, STP +11.6%, FSLR +6.5%, JASO +6.5%, TSL +6.4%, SOL +6.2%, JKS +5.7%, YGE +5.1%, LDK +4.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 2 Comments
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) +32.4% premarket after receiving a positive opinion for...

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) +32.4% premarket after receiving a positive opinion for conditional approval of its pixuvri lymphoma treatment from the European Medicines Agency. CTIC expects that a marketing authorization should be granted by the European Commission within a few months.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) gets approval to build a solar farm in Los Angeles County and complete...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) gets approval to build a solar farm in Los Angeles County and complete a $1.36B deal with Exelon (NYSE:EXC). Last year, Exelon had agreed to purchase the farm, paying First Solar to build and operate the facility. First Solar +6.4% premarket. (SunPower earnings helping too)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • GIS

    General Mills (NYSE:GIS) cuts FQ3 guidance, citing "weak performance across U.S. retail food...

    General Mills (NYSE:GIS) cuts FQ3 guidance, citing "weak performance across U.S. retail food categories in December and January." FQ3 EPS now expected at $0.54-$0.56. FY2012 EPS revised to $2.53-$2.55 from $2.59-$2.61. Shares -4% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD), in freefall this morning on disappointing trial results, presents...

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD), in freefall this morning on disappointing trial results, presents a good buying opportunity, says Deutsche Bank. DB believes a disaster scenario is unlikely and that additional data will look better, allowing Gilead to take more than 15% marketshare. DB maintains its $66 price target; GILD -18.3% to $44.79.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • GILD

    The reaction of other Hep C drug makers to the news from Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD): Idenix...

    The reaction of other Hep C drug makers to the news from Gilead (NASDAQ:GILD): Idenix (NASDAQ:IDIX) -2.5%, Vertex (NASDAQ:VRTX) +9.4%, Achillion (NASDAQ:ACHN) +12.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) plummets after disappointing results for Hepatitis C patients in...

    Gilead Sciences (NASDAQ:GILD) plummets after disappointing results for Hepatitis C patients in its ELECTRON study. The majority of patients with a prior "null" response "experienced viral relapse within 4 weeks of completing" the treatment. Shares -21.6% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 15 Comments
